results.description: Used two high-coverage rsk70 fields to capture stock momentum relative to market. Applied SUGGESTION1 (multi-datafield) and SUGGESTION4 (high userCount fields). SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector field). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage > 0.6). Kept implementation short and within operator/datafield limits. Confidence: 0.70

Short names with high hedge fund ownership tend to mean-revert. Applied SUGGESTION1 (combine hedge_fund_ownership_percent and daily_specific_return), SUGGESTION4 (hedge fields have high userCount). SUGGESTION2/3 not used. Kept under operator/datafield caps. Confidence: 0.65

Favor momentum in smaller caps by dividing momentum by market cap. Used SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 (current_market_cap_usd has high counts). No vector fields so SUGGESTION2 skipped. Coverage OK so SUGGESTION3 skipped. Implementation kept simple. Confidence: 0.60

High short interest amplifies momentum signals. Used SUGGESTION1 combining short_interest_factor_score and momentum. Both have good coverage so no backfill. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Kept concise. Confidence: 0.63

Stocks with high positive sentiment and recent negative specific returns may revert up. Applied SUGGESTION1 (sentiment + daily_specific_return) and used high userCount sentiment. No vectors/backfill. Confidence: 0.62

Combine value factor loadings with residual volatility to favor undervalued low-residual-vol stocks. SUGGESTION1 used rsk70 value and resvol. SUGGESTION4 applied. No vector/backfill. Kept short. Confidence: 0.66

Momentum in firms with improving earnings quality may persist. Used SUGGESTION1 (momentum and earnqlty). earnqlty coverage ~0.95 so no ts_backfill. SUGGESTION2 not relevant. Implementation compact. Confidence: 0.58

High dividend yield but falling specific returns may mean reversal. Applied SUGGESTION1 (divyild & daily_specific_return) and SUGGESTION4 (divyild high userCount). No vector/backfill. Simple operators. Confidence: 0.55
